name: The Diary of Anne Frank - The Play Quiz | Literature | 20 Questions

questions.text: Who finds Anne's diary in the beginning of the play?
questions.explanation:
Miep.

	Anne Frank was born on June 12, 1929.

questions.text: Where was Anne born?
questions.explanation:
Germany.

	She was born in Frankfurt, Germany, but migrated to Holland when Hitler came to power.

questions.text: What is Mrs. Van Daan's first name?
questions.explanation:
Petronella.

	The Van Daan's stayed in the attic with the Franks. Anne was not very fond of Mrs. Van Daan.

questions.text: What is Peter's cat's name?
questions.explanation:
Mouschi.

	Peter was the Van Daan's son, who later on started to like Anne Frank. He gave her her first "real" kiss.

questions.text: What were the hours they had to be completely silent?
questions.explanation:
8am-6pm.

	The workers came at 8:30 and left at 5:30, but to be safe they added the extra half hour each way.

questions.text: What did Anne call her father?
questions.explanation:
Pim.

	Mr. Frank's first name was Otto.

questions.text: What did Anne's class call her in school because she talked so much?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Quack Quack

	Peter mentions this in scene three of the play when he is fed up with the fact that Anne never stops talking.

questions.text: What is the name of the dentist that comes to stay with them?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Dussel

	"Mr. Dussel" was the name Anne Frank gave Fritz Pfeffer. For Hanukkah, Anne gave Mr. Dussel some ear plugs she made for him out of cotton and candle wax so that he wouldn't have to hear her tossing at night.

questions.text: What is the name of Anne's best friend at school?
questions.explanation:
Jopie DeWaals.

	Jopie was also killed by the Nazis. Anne finds out that she is gone from Mr. Dussel.

questions.text: Anne gives her mother an IOU for doing as she is told. How many hours is it good for?
questions.explanation:
10.

	Anne did not get along very well with her mother, she always felt her mother didn't understand her.

questions.text: What does Miep bring them all on New Year's?
questions.explanation:
cake.

	The cake says: "Peace in 1944." The year before the cake said "Peace in 1943." Miep explains this by saying "Well it has to come sometime you know."

questions.text: Who brings Anne's cake to her when she gets upset and goes to her room?
questions.explanation:
Peter.

	At first Peter couldn't stand Anne, but now he is very grateful she is there.

questions.text: Who thinks that Peter and Anne are doing evil things in Peter's room?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Van Daan

	Peter and Anne have been talking in his room because they understand each other. Although as time goes on, and they get older they start to fall for each other, and eventually do kiss as well.

questions.text: What time does Mrs. Frank say Anne is going to bed?
questions.explanation:
9.

	She says this to keep Mrs. Van Daan happy, so that Anne won't be in Peter's room all night long.

questions.text: What does Anne say she'd like to be when she grows up?
questions.explanation:
journalist.

	She says she wants to be remembered after she is dead. Ironically, even though she died so young, she still is remembered thanks to her diary.

questions.text: What does Mr. Van Daan steal?
questions.explanation:
a loaf of bread.

	This is the breaking point for Mrs. Frank. She says that she wants the Van Daan's out of there.

questions.text: How many ships does Miep say have landed?
questions.explanation:
4,000.

	The invasion Miep is talking about is D-Day.

questions.text: On which day do Anne and the others get captured?
questions.explanation:
Friday.

	According to Mr. Dussel, it was Friday 4th of August, 1944.

questions.text: Who was it that turned them all in (according to the play)?
options: no one, they were just too noisy
questions.explanation:
the thief.

	A lamp fell earlier, and the thief heard it while he was downstairs. Later on, Mr. Kraler tells Mr. Frank it was the thief who turned them in.

questions.text: Who is the only survivor?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Frank

	I love the last two lines of the play. "Anne's Voice: In spite of everything I still believe that people are good.Mr. Frank: She puts me to shame."
